definition: Liu Yu, founder of Southern dynasty Song 劉宋|刘宋, broke away from Eastern Jin in 420

Emperor Wu of Song (363-422), personal name Liu Yu 劉裕|刘裕[Liu2 Yu4], founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned 420-422
Song of the Southern dynasties (420-479), with capital at Nanjing/also known as Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋

first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
rebellion against Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁 in 548

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
